page.title: 14Religion in Holbeach Bank
page.content: St. Martin's Church was built in 1970. It is half Methodist and half Church of England. About 20 people go to the services.They have services on alternate Sundays .On the 1st and 3rd weeks of the month Methodist services are at 9.30am. On the 2nd and 4th weeks of the month there are Anglican services at 10.00 or 8.45.Sunday school is held every week from 10.45 to 12.o'clock and about 30 children go .They sing, read, draw and go on outings in the summer. St. Martin's Church does not look like a church from the outside. It is a square shape and does not have a spire. Inside it is carpeted and there are chairs arranged in a semi circle.The altar is across the corner of the church. The Methodist service at Moulton Seas End is at 2.30pm on Sunday. There are 5 members.
